cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.current_location: about 95 miles ESE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move generally north-north-east, strengthen into a hurricane over the east-central Gulf, make landfall along Florida’s Big Bend Wednesday, then curve NE across GA/SC and accelerate northeastward just inland or offshore of the Mid-Atlantic (VA/NC coasts) late Thursday before heading into the western Atlantic.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend (between Englewood and Indian Pass)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Englewood to Indian Pass FL; Tropical Storm Watch south of Englewood to Chokoloskee FL and Dry Tortugas.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning for portions of Yucatan Peninsula and Pinar del Rio, Cuba.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast, then inland across GA/SC and the coastal Carolinas to the Mid-Atlantic including southeastern Virginia.
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤5%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts 30–40 mph possible Thursday–Friday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor water-level rises (<3 ft) possible in lower Chesapeake Bay and adjacent waterways during onshore flow Thursday night.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of moderate to heavy rain could bring 1–3 inches Thursday into early Friday, producing localized ponding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents and elevated seas could disrupt vessel traffic and cargo operations throughout the lower Chesapeake Bay entrance.
